newsitem.title: FRANCE: Renault says plant closure irrevocable.
newsitem.headline: Renault says plant closure irrevocable.

text.p: Renault's decision to close the Vilvoorde assembly plant in Belgium is irrevocable, a company spokeswoman said on Monday.
"The decision to close the plant is irrevocable. The closure will take place before the end of July," she told Reuters.
She declined to comment on a declaration by a union spokesman in Belgium that Chairman Louis Schweitzer had agreed to a meeting with Belgian unions on Wednesday.
But she reiterated that Schweitzer has said for the past 15 days that he is willing to meet representatives of the plant's 3,100 workers to discuss measures accompanying the closure.
Renault announced on February 27 that it would close the Vilvoorde plant in the suburbs of Brussels as part of a reorganisation of its European car assembly operations.
The French carmaker announced at the same time that it expected a significant loss for 1996, including a 2.4 billion franc charge for the plant closure.
